frameDefinitions: A Competition comes to an end, with a Competitor tying, winning, or losing against an Opponent (or opponents) according to their Score.
An Agent or a Cause disperses or scatters Individuals from the Source,a relatively confined space, to a the Goal_area, a broader space.
An Agent, by virtue of strength or forcefulness, controls, rules, or strongly influences some Patient in some Situation.
A Winner has victory over an Loser.
This frame is about Items in the state of occupying a certain Rank within a hierarchy.
In this frame a Profiled_item is higher that its Standard_item on a scale with respect to some Attribute.
frameExamples: Unbelievable--he <t>lost</t> the gold medal by just .02 points!
She <t>scattered</t> his ashes in the bay.
The fireballing righthander looked poised to <t>dominate</t> the Yankees yet again, striking out seven straight batters during one stretch
He <t>ranks</t> second in his class in mathematics.
Notices for the Shield Theater's production of Macbeth <t>surpassed</t> all previous reviews .
listRoleDefinitions: The individual involved in the <fen>Competition</fen>.
The individual that the <fen>Competitor</fen> has been competing against.
The individuals who compete against each other.
The event in which the <fen>Competitors</fen> compete with each other.
The time at which the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.
The location at which the <fen>Competition</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen> disperses or scatters the <fen>Individuals</fen>.
The <fen>Individuals</fen> are scattered by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
An event or force that causes that <fen>Individuals</fen> to disperse.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Individuals</fen> are dispersed.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the dispersing event happens.
The <fen>Agent</fen> controls the Patient by being forceful and possibly aggressive.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is trying to gain control of a situation, but ends up being subject to the control and influence of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The time when the domination takes place.
The place where the domination occurs.
The individual or individuals who beat the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The individual or individuals that get beat by the <fen>Winner</fen>.
When the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory <fen>Loser</fen>.
The <fen>Rank</fen> which the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The Item which occupies the Rank in the hierarchy.
The dimension along which the ranking is defined.
The time at which/period over which the <fen>Item</fen> occupies the <fen>Rank</fen>
The role <fen>Standard_item</fen> denotes the entities that are exceeded by the <fen>Item</fen> with regard to the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The <fen>Profiled_item</fen> is the entity that is located closest to the end of the scale evoked by some <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The <fen>Attribute</fen> is a property that evokes a scale along which the <fen>Item</fen> is located closer to one extreme in  comparison to the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
The <fen>Standard_attribute</fen> is used when the standard is a specific value on  a scale.
The <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen> is a particular value on a scale which is being compared to an <fen>Attribute</fen> or <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Item</fen> is higher on the scale than the <fen>Standard</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Their role models might have dominated women <fex>in the past</fex>; they may not have understood the concept of equality.
Women tend to dominatemen <fex>at home and at Church</fex>.
He ranks second in his class <fex>in mathematics</fex>.
Jim ranked as thirty-second degree Mason <fex>in 1970</fex>.
In her time, she outstripped <fex>most politician in the country</fex>.
<fex>The buildings</fex> were outstripped in beauty and grace many years ago.
